sect1.sect2:
Introduction to xdg-desktop-portal
xdg-desktop-portal is a D-Bus service that allows applications to interact with the desktop in a safe way. Several aspects of desktop interaction, like file chooser, desktop style, etc are implemented in different D-Bus APIs, known as portals. Sandboxed applications benefit the most from this service since they don't need special permissions to use the portal APIs, but any application can use it. xdg-desktop-portal safeguards many resources and features with a user-controlled permission system. This service needs a backend implementing desktop-specific portal interfaces.

sect2.title: Installation of xdg-desktop-portal
sect2.para: Install xdg-desktop-portal by running the following commands:

screen.userinput:
mkdir build && cd build &&
meson setup --prefix=/usr --buildtype=release .. && ninja

sect2.para: If you have installed the needed dependencies, you can test the results by running ninja test. Six tests are known to fail if you are not using and are in GNOME.

sect3.title: Config Files
sect3.para: The main configuration files are ~/.config/xdg-desktop-portal/portals.conf, /etc/xdg-desktop-portal/portals.conf, and /usr/share/xdg-desktop-portal/portals.conf. Several other locations can be searched for configuration files. See portals.conf(5).

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: The various configuration files are used to choose the backend depending of various conditions. See portals.conf(5) for details.
